alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Doddridge; Gilmer; Harrison; Jackson; Lewis; Pleasants; Ritchie; Tyler; Wirt; Wood (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 03 at 3:43PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 AM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Ohio and West Virginia, including the following counties, in southeast Ohio, Washington. In West Virginia, Calhoun, Doddridge, Gilmer, Harrison, Jackson, Lewis, Pleasants, Ritchie, Tyler, Wirt and Wood. * WHEN...Until 330 AM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 337 PM EST, Doppler radar and area gauges indicated between 1 and 1.25 inches of rain had fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Freezing rain will gradually become the dominant precipitation type late this afternoon and evening. However, continued runoff will contribute to rising creeks and streams through the evening. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Clarksburg, Marietta, Harrisville, Elizabeth, Bridgeport, Williamstown, Shinnston, Nutter Fort, Salem, Pennsboro, West Union, Anmoore, and Mineralwells. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.

area.areaDesc: Calhoun; Doddridge; Gilmer; Harrison; Jackson; Lewis; Pleasants; Ritchie; Tyler; Wirt; Wood
